fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let H=\{\sigma _{1},…,\sigma _{n}\} so n=|H|, let m=[\Bbbk : \mathbb {F}]. Either n\geq m (as desired) or n < m (which we will prove leads to contradiction).
Case 1: n\geq m. Well, this is the desired result.
Case 2: n < m (there are fewer automorphisms than \mathbb {F}-linearly independent elements of \Bbbk ).
For each i=1,…,m we write \alpha _{i}=(\sigma _{1}a_{i},\sigma _{2}a_{i},…,\sigma _{n}a_{i})\in \Bbbk ^{n}. Since m>n, the \alpha _{i} must be linearly dependent.
Claim 1: For any \sigma \in H and (c_{1},…,c_{r})\in U, we have (\sigma c_{1},…,\sigma c_{r})\in U.

Claim 3: Contradiction. Let (c_{1},…,c_{r})\in U be nonzero, and without loss of generality assume c_{1}=1. For each \sigma \in H, we see: (\sigma 1,\sigma c_{2},…,\sigma c_{r})=(1,\sigma c_{2},…,\sigma c_{r}). By claim 2, \dim _{\Bbbk }(V)=1, which implies (1,\sigma c_{2},…,\sigma c_{r}) must be a scalar multiple of (1,c_{2},…,c_{r}). But this implies \sigma c_{i}=c_{i} for each i and for each \sigma \in H. Then c_{i}\in \mathbb {F} by definition of \mathbb {F} (being the subfield of fixedpoints under H). Then we have for each j, \sum ^{r}_{i=1}c_{i}\sigma _{j}(a_{i})=0, which implies \sigma \left (\sum ^{r}_{i=1}c_{i}a_{i}\right )=0, which means \sum ^{r}_{i=1}c_{i}a_{i}=0. This contradicts the linear independence of a_{i}.

fr:title.text: Size of finite subgroup of field automorphisms is not less than index of subfield fixed by the subgroup

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Size of finite subgroup of field automorphisms is not less than index of subfield fixed by the subgroup

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let \Bbbk be a field, let H\leq \mathop {\textrm {Aut}}\nolimits (\Bbbk ) be a finite subgroup of field automorphisms. If \mathbb {F}=\Bbbk ^{H} is the subfield fixed by H, then |H|\geq [\Bbbk : \mathbb {F}].
